subject: Re: RS-12-469  How to slow down scan/voices????
author: judy_in_hollywood
full_text:
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Rhonda W <rhondak1973@...> wrote:
>
> If you use a recording program ...like Goldwave...you can actually 
slow them down while you listen to the playback, can ever listen to 
them backwards.  But I dont know of a way to slow down the sweep.  
Are you using the AM or FM band? And have you tried switching to the 
other band(the one ur not using)?  Ive tried a session on the FM band 
but it doesnt really seem to work for some reason but the AM does 
good and Ive gotten a response that indicates that they agree with 
the AM being better here.
>    
>   Rhonda           Hi Rhonda, I'm not sure what Goldwave is (is it 
used on a computer?)! I am currently online at the local library's PC 
as at home I only have a Webtv unit to go online & that's limited! I 
have a Laptop, but it's not connected to the internet - as I use it 
with DVD's or software programes only.   =Judy=   
>   
> 
> judy_in_hollywood <Ticket_to_Heaven@...> wrote:
>           Hi All, Have been doing sessions and sometimes get a 
voice or more that 
> just jumps in and says a word or two durring the scan, but most of 
the 
> time it seems it's like a room full of people talking very fast and 
> thus I can't seem to hear them well enough to hear if they are 
giving 
> me any messages! Am I the only one with this issue? How can I slow 
this 
> down to hear better? =Judy= P.S. I only use the RS 12-469 with 
> portable folding Craig speakers & a Sony cassette recorder with 
> earphones (cups over ears). I sometimes use an external mic or just 
the 
> cassette recorder's mic.
> 
> 
> 
>                            
> 
>        
> ---------------------------------
> Never miss a thing.   Make Yahoo your homepage.
>
